title: Patrice Evra tells Nicolas Pepe to 'build massive body' after slow Arsenal start
text:
Nicolas Pepe missed a sitter in Arsenal’s defeat at Sheffield United (Picture: Getty)

Patrice Evra has told Arsenal new boy Nicolas Pepe to ‘build a massive body’ in the gym in order to cope with the physical demands of the Premier League.

Pepe, 24, has struggled to live up to expectations following his club-record £72million move from Lille to Arsenal, scoring just one goal from the penalty spot in the side’s 3-2 win over Aston Villa last month.

Against Sheffield United on Monday evening, Pepe started a flowing counter-attack to create a golden chance for himself, but the Ivorian scuffed his effort wide from six yards out.

Lys Mousset then found the net with a scrappy close-range strike to condemn Arsenal to another away defeat. The north London club are now without a win in their last four games on the road.

Evra hopes supporters are patient with summer signing Pepe (Picture: Sky Sports)

Speaking ahead of the match, Manchester United legend Evra pleaded with Arsenal fans to be patient with Pepe as he adapts to English football.

He also urged Pepe to give himself the best possible chance of succeeding in the Premier League by transforming his physique.

‘I think the big price tag doesn’t help, big pressure,’ Evra said on Sky Sports’ Monday Night Football.

‘Some fans don’t understand. It doesn’t mean if you’re bought for £70-100million that you will score 30 goals.

Mousset scored the only goal of the game at Bramall Lane (Picture: Getty)

‘[Pierre-Emerick] Aubameyang did but he played for many years and scored many goals so you have to give time to Pepe. I believe in this player.

‘I think he just needs to realise that the Premier League is completely different to the French league.

‘You should be stronger so maybe he should go in the gym and build a massive body and you will see because he is talented.

‘The problem is that he’s under pressure. I want to see if now mentally he will be strong enough.’

Evra revealed that even Paul Scholes questioned his credentials when he first arrived at Old Trafford, but he managed to prove his doubters wrong through hard work.

‘I came to Manchester and in my first six months even Scholesy says he thinks I was a joker and we should sell him back to Monaco!’ Evra said.

Advertisement

‘But those things help me, they make me stronger. When me and [Nemanja] Vidic were substituted in a reserve game, some people were saying we were poor.

‘After that we proved them wrong. Why? Because I worked hard in the summer and became the player I was.’

Unai Emery admitted Pepe’s missed chance was a ‘key’ moment in Arsenal’s defeat at Bramall Park.

‘The chance for us, for Pepe, was the key because if they score the first goal, defensively they are a very strong team,’ the Spaniard said.

‘Pepe is improving but the next step for him is to score.

‘Usually he is going to score chances like that – but tonight he didn’t take his chance.’

Emery insists Pepe is ‘improving’ after a slow start at Arsenal (Picture: Getty)

Emery added: ‘We had more possession, more chances, more shots and for example, Pepe is improving and I think Pepe’s way with us is little-by-little getting better.

‘The next step is to score. Tonight for example, the best chance is one he is usually going to score but tonight he didn’t take that with efficiency.

‘He also had two shots that were very important. I think he is improving and taking confidence with us. But it is one process.’
